Subject: Re: [neat] Quick question on how NEAT works
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770077; y=NXO-WaIWVKrDCHXyFLqo5hVh7xfq8Bmx3mPOLyhCre5OVZilqiV1
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod
From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

Hi Kelvin,

On 21 February 2016 at 20:33, kelvinzdragon@... [neat]
<neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
>
> When evolving, does the algorithm:
>
>
> 1. Take inputs from sensors, processes them (creating a Neural Network in
> the process), then returns the outputs
>
> 2. Creates a Neural Network based on # inputs and # outputs, then evaluates
> network by inputting sensory information, and returning output.
>

The network structure and weights are already defined by the time we
come to evaluate a network, which we do by assigning inputs from
sensors, activating the network and reading the outputs. For a given
problem the number of inputs and outputs are generally fixed, so we're
searching and evolving the connectivity of everything in between the
input and output nodes.

 - Colin
